H0.text: Ionization is the process responsible for increasing the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere as temperatures increase.

H1.text: Evaporation is the process responsible for increasing the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere as temperatures increase.

H2.text: Respiration is the process responsible for increasing the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere as temperatures increase.

H3.text: Condensation is the process responsible for increasing the amount of water vapor in the atmosphere as temperatures increase.

A4.text: Evaporation proceeds more quickly at higher temperatures.

A5.text: The higher the temperature of the substance, the greater the kinetic energy of the molecules at its surface and therefore the faster the rate of their evaporation.
